title: Bug 120922: 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs to be improved
description:
Bug 120922: 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs to be improved. Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved. And then the user needs to figure out how to save or discard their changes. Do you want to save the changes? [Yes] [No] [Cancel]. 

Yes would save the changes. 
No would discard the changes. 
Cancel would do nothing and remain on the Source page. 
In addition, the dialog is titled 'Error'.

Observed Behavior (OB): If you edit the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and then try to switch back to the Layout view, you will get an error message indicating that you need to save your changes. This problem is that the user has to figure out what they need to do to save the changes (or discard them, which is even harder) and the error message is not very clear. The error message is 'Source page is dirty'.

Expected Behavior (EB): A better and more typical approach would be that when the XML Report Design has been changed, the dialog should use a better title (and should not have quotes).

Steps to Reproduce (SR): 1. Open XML Report Designer. 2. Edit some XML content in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor. 3. Attempt to switch back to the Layout view. 4. Observe the error message.
